pros: The longer you're there, the more PTO you accrue. The culture is progressive and it is like being a part of a big family.

pros: Benefits Fridays Off Random vacation days PAL accrual but cons also
cons: Manager is the wife of the doctor. Micro manage everything Barely time to speak to coworkers. If a chart is up you have to get it immediately but the doctor can wait an hour before seeing the first 5 patients if he wants. Manager doesn’t allow you off if you don’t have the PTO accrued even though the handbook says it’s manager discretion, even if your parent is dying.. Doctor manssplains everything. They say it’s 64 hours but you’re off every Friday and every Wednesday afternoon except one Wednesday a month, so you might need a second job! They take random weeks off every quarter and they only tell you a couple

review_title: Executive VPs Take Care of Themselves
pros: Staff members are caring and professional
cons: Toxic environment. Nobody trusts the C-Suite. Top Executives say they want transparency, but they will ruthlessly get rid of anyone who disagrees with them. To save money, they recently fired 20+ Executive Directors and Directors - with no plan for who/how departments would report. Most of those let go were over 50 with long tenure at Cone. They were outstanding and trusted leaders. Now the rest of us are looking over our shoulders. The COO is unfit to lead a system and the CEO has zero hospital operations experience. In fact, they hired a retired COO to mentor her. He is a bully so that’s what she’s learning. Maybe that’s why the system has lost $15 million this year.

pros: The unit I worked on always tried to promote togetherness and teamwork. They tried to be fair with weekend and holiday rotations. Overall, i preferred working there part time and picking up shifts when I could. It was okay for a hospital.
cons: Need more staff and more communication with leadership

review_title: Financial struggle and bad management and toxic culture
pros: Great location. Historic and well intentioned mission
cons: Cronyism in management. THe CEO got rid of all prior management and put in  90% as new structure. Many of them are friends of CEO. Took a HR person who has no health care experience other than HR and put in as COO who had to be trained into COO role by the VPs. Meanwhile, they are bleeding $$$$. CEO has hired a friend  Chief Clinical Officer and his linkedin profiles still has him in Alabama though he has been in this job for 2 years.!!! Talk about brand identification and culture. HE is downright rude and berates at everyone. Talk about core values!!   Practices that they took over to manage which were profitable are all at loss.

pros: I have worked with Cone for many years and they care about their employees. They encourage work/life balance and offer many forms of support from mental health to physical health.
cons: Salary could be a little more competitive.

job_title: Assistant Director of Nursing in Greensboro, NC
pros: “I stay at Cone Health because I found my home and what I love to do. I always thought I knew exactly what that was, but life has a funny way of changing course without our consent. It’s easy now to look back and be thankful that my path changed from my original plan… but at the time I was kicking and screaming the whole way. I have met some amazing peers, had some inspiring mentors, and have been given more opportunities than I ever imagined. From the Residency Program to the PNAP program, and now ENLA, I can’t wait to see the direction I go in the future.”

job_title: Registered Nurse in High Point, NC
pros: I have worked full time at Cone Health for 12 years. The beginning of that time was VERY ROCKY. I have witnessed CH go through massive culture changes and growing pains. I never thought I’d be here for over a decade, but Cone has grown into an organization that I am proud to be a part of. They truly care about their employees and take feedback very seriously. My direct manager is one of the best people I know.
cons: There have been many growing pains over the years, and I have had managers that truly should not be managing other humans. As the culture shifted, so did the expectations of how employees are treated, and how employees are expected to treat one another. The cost of the health insurance is the only con I can think of, it is expensive and the coverage is TERRIBLE. A health system should take care of their own employees’ health without super high deductibles, copays and frequent denials of claims.

review_title: Not a great place to work
pros: Good salary with excellent benefits. Good peers.
cons: Horrible leadership currently. Since the former CEO left, things have changed. It’s not the same Cone and probably never will be. Truly sad.

job_title: Talent Acquisition Consultant in Greensboro, NC
pros: This organization strives to do what's best for our patients, their families, the communities we serve, and our employees. Supportive culture of growth and development. Diverse and inclusive team.
cons: We are in need of more nurses.

job_title: Epic Applications Analyst II in Greensboro, NC
pros: Fair Pay and fair benefits
cons: Pay not up with national average; merging with new company - unsure of future

review_title: Technologists Beware: Politics, mismanagement & carer undermining
pros: The pay is (somewhat) competitive for the Triad area, as are  the benefits. There are SOME good, trustworthy people that make great co-workers.
cons: Diagnostic Imaging dept. is, unfortunately, a mess. Unless you're "friends" with upper management and/or chosen by them for whatever particular reason, I've seen people who've served reliably and faithfully for years shut out and shut down when going for a promotion or even attempting to make a lateral move from one Imaging modality to another, myself included. I was effectively blocked out of another modality, after I spent a year of hard work and sacrifice to get certified in that modality. They actually hired a classmate of mine, who had no previous healthcare background, over me who'd been there for years, problem free, good performance reviews, no disciplinary action, excellent attendance record, etc., because the manager of that dept. personally didn't like me. Same thing when I tried to make a shift change; supervisor played favorites with who he wanted on his shift  & upper management let him. Problem is, Cone is SOOO large everybody knows somebody there & they control half the Triad so if you get labeled negatively in any way whatsoever, you're career is seriously impacted.

review_title: Great place to work; fantastic culture
job_title: PGY2 Pharmacy Resident in Greensboro, NC
pros: collaborative, relies on residents to execute on projects
cons: needs improved research output by pharmacy staff

pros: The benefits and paid time off were good.

pros: earning a check for bills
cons: management is fake. they lie.

review_title: I loved working in an exciting environment with a variety of patients trauma and psychiatric circumstances
pros: I felt that my background in psychology helped me relate to the patients and helped advocate for their care when most staff were more concerned about the excitement of trauma and the adrenaline rush.  I felt I was able to use my psy knowledge to collaborate with the physicians and help deescalation interventions before jumping into pharmacological and physical restraints
cons: I found my suggestions often overlooked in these trauma and stressful situations and frequently became discouraged and often reprimanded for "catering" to these patients who deserve the same quality of care. I often found myself in the office for complaints from my co-workers who did not agree with my nursing care for these patients who deserve our equal services

pros: Pay is decent compared to other healthcare facilities.
cons: Poor upper management; poor job security

review_title: Cone Health, not just Moses Cone Hospital
pros: I worked with some of the most intelligent and innovative people that eventually moved on to leadership roles within the system. Endless opportunities for advancement if you're up for the challenge. I always felt like I was informed and involved with whatever was going on. I felt appreciated, which was motivating. I was able to get the information I needed to do my job with ease through the reporting applications. Continuity across service lines made pulling data easier, allowing for more time to analyze. I was given opportunities to try new things outside of my scope which offered exposure to different aspects of financial planning.
cons: It was challenging to support the entire system with a small team. Definitely worked long hours, but it wasn't so bad when you're working alongside others who are truly passionate about their work and were always willing to help you. I felt like my bosses invested in teaching me everything they knew so I could be successful.

review_title: Would recommend to a nurse or doctor, but nothing less
pros: You can transfer into new positions after 6 months, but good luck. Some sups will write you up so you can't leave their department.
cons: There is almost a cast system here. You can clearly see the level of hierarchy. Some of the people higher up don't even look your way when you attempt to speak to them. The pay is not great for a lot of people and it's very difficult to move into other positions despite having a degree!

review_title: Great place to work however the pay does not meet the work load.
pros: Great team and great benefits.
cons: There is a lot of responsibility placed on Techs, we practically do everything except give out medications or start IV's. The tech to patient ratio is often 1:8 on a good fully staffed day. And we are required to help others with their assignments when needed and still keep up to your work. Often we have 3 nurses giving us orders and getting upset because they are behind and feel as though "you are not helping" however they fail to realize that you were just elbow deep for another patient that may not been theirs but none the less still matters. This job is great at teaching you and giving you experience but no real growth professionally unless you go back to school and get some additional degrees.

review_title: Good Health System to Work With
pros:
low cost health, vision and dental
low cost meds at outpatient pharmacy
flexible/remote work
cons: employee share of health insurance and healthcare costs rising but salaries staying the same.

review_title: Worst employer company to work for!
job_title: Patient Care Coordinator in Greensboro, NC
pros: It's better than unemployment,decent benefits, good opportunity to meet people from different walks of life.
cons: Management plays a lot of favoritism, no leadership skills, no integrity. Cone has a 6 month probation policy for new employees which basically means if management doesn't like you, you can be fired for any or no reason at all (in other words no job security). Human resources will not work in your favor, they cover for each other and will not return your calls if  they don't like what you have to say. Now employees that management DOES like can get away with surfing the Internet while at work, taking personal calls all day and calling patients 'idiots' when they're not around, they lie to get you in trouble and talk about each other behind their backs. Totally unprofessional, worst place to ever work for. Salary is below average also.

pros: Great benefits, good pay. Executive Management seems to really believe in their mission/values, they are just completely clueless about how much their middle management is undercutting the work they are doing.
cons: Middle Management (department supervisors/directors) are the main cause of high turnover and extremely tense work environments. This is the case for any department I came in contact with during my 12 years of employment there. They feel they can do as they please and treat employees however they want because they get away with it constantly. I have been berated for something as little as asking for a copy of guidelines they wanted enforced in writing.

job_title: Clinic Triage Registered Nurse in Greensboro, NC
pros: Good benefits, kind of expensive, lots of companies offer discounts to Cone employees
cons: Very strict attendance policy, doesn't matter if it's life and death or not, also, if they think you're too sick to work, no matter what you say, they will send you home for 48hrs and count it against you on their attendance points system. The job load was unbelievable, never get caught up, won't hire additional help, get 'talked to' when you're so far behind you feel like you're drowning instead of offering some help

pros: Decent salary, good benefits
cons: Management in operative services is broken. Staff not valued, expected to go from one OR to the next. Require nurses to get BSN if they do not have it. To be a new RN 4 or assistant director you have to have a masters but they’ll hire an unexpirenced director without a masters and change job titles so others don’t have to get masters. Why would you require RN 4 and AD to have masters but hire Director without one already in place???

pros:
Wide assortment of open positions - can transfer after 6 months in current position.
Free access to in-house gyms at most locations (charge at ARMC).
Employee discounts.
cons:
Anti-white racism is rampant.
Management too involved in dramatics to manage well.
Inadequate staffing - overworked employees.
No respect for experience (hiring new employees at equal pay as experienced workers).
Required training outside of typical work schedule.

pros: Flexible with schedule and management was great. The way they handle working on holidays was impressive. 6 recognized holidays and you were required to prioritize them from most wanted to work and least wanted to work. You are required to work 2 holidays. I always got the top two choices for myself which were Black Friday (2nd shift) and New Years Day (2nd shift).
cons: Had to be able to work on an on-call basis from time to time. Traveled to different hospital/Emergency Departments from time to time to help out as needed with staffing issues. However, compensation for traveling is offered.

pros: Cone Health truly cares about their employees. They offer great insurance plans for employees and their families and overall the benefits are better than anyone else. I absolutely love working here.
cons: You have to be a manager or higher to make very good money. The middle class people kinda get the short end of the stick.

pros: Well known organization that is well respected. Cone employees many and gives each employee the opportunity to advance as he or she chooses to do.
cons: Management is not professional and contradicts themselves. They are not family oriented and they do not care about their employees. Cone doesn't really hold up their mission statement. Management is judgemental and unethical.

pros: Its a really good place to work on people skills, as far as communication,being presentable and being able to help/care for others!! Being to have the experience to work in an hospital has made me become more open to people more than I am normally.
cons: There's not too many downsided things to say, nothing that we don't deal with in our everyday life's...  Communication could be better and sometimes how we as people handle situations could be better

pros: Commitment to patients and the community.
cons: Despite the stated commitment to one another - non-executive employees haven't gotten a raise in over 2 years.  The executives had their BONUSES reduced, but they still get them.  Cone is also a nurse driven organization.  That isn't always bad...but nurses don't know how to do everything and sometimes you need people who know the business and technology side of things.

job_title: Assistant Director of Nursing in Greensboro, NC
pros:
Cone Health is an innovative health system that is always looking for ways to improve quality care as well as staff satisfaction.
Cone Health encourages continuing education and offers generous tuition reimbursement.
The "culture" of the health system has changed overtime and it does not always put finances ahead of patient care and staff satisfaction.  Evidence has proven that "happy employees" promote "happy patients" and quality outcomes.
cons: None.  It is the best place to work!

pros: Great company to work for. Great benefits. Newest technology. Employee involvement.
cons: Department management is micromanaged. Very underhanded. Act like they care but really just want to get rid of people who challenge them. Making employees look disgruntled when they are really telling the truth. Very sad because Cone Health is an awesome company to work for.

job_title: Mental Health Technician in Greensboro, NC
pros: Good benefits. Good pay. Great people to work with. Good intentions.
cons: They preach i-Care yet they (management & CEOs) are hard pressed to follow it. They would rather give you pizza parties and Christmas parties then sufficient staffing on a regular basis. Understandably healthcare is a business, but they need to figure out a different way to meet the bottom line other than having their staff suffer on a daily basis.

review_title: It was great till new management was hired.
pros: Time off wasn't bad and had discounts at a lot of places. Benifits were just ok definitely not great.  I loved my job till they brought in a manager that would lie to get rid of people and  of course upper management will back their managers because they don't know.
cons: Management, bad compensation for travel between offices

pros: flexible scheduling, small town hospital, friendly coworkers who know each other, great hourly pay for per diem/prn, employee parking deck, exercise classes and continuing ed offered
cons: can have a poor staffing ratio, micro managing at times, little to no late night food options, prn is first to get called off or floated, hours not guaranteed, no benefits for per diem

pros: Cone Health pays more for per diem nurses than other companies in the area, such as Novant Health.  Nurse managers also strove to not give 6 patients daily.
cons: We were often understaffed with nurses taking 5-6 post-CABG patients, and the charge nurse was rarely able to help the other nurses.

pros: Plenty of overtime, bonuses are possible, discounts at local businesses.
cons: Workload is overwhelming, management purposely schedules less people to save money, very high turnover rate, low pay (starts at $10.66; they started me at $10.80/hr with 4 years of experience), and unfortunately, nurse techs are treated badly when they float to unfamiliar areas.

job_title: Prefer Not to Answer in Greensboro, NC
pros: The people are like family, The benefits are better than average...with such a large company you have access to so much more at little cost to you!
cons: As with any employer there are always cons, but with Cone Health and my position the only one I can think of is that upper upper management doesn't seem to always think out the full impact of their decions.

review_title: Great Company, Great team, Great results
pros: I worked in the cardiac cath lab at Moses Cone. Definitely one of the most talented Doctors, Nurses, Rad Techs, CVTs, Respiratory Therapists, CV Assists, and secretaries that I have ever worked with. We had great results and we worked hard for each other.
cons: Salary could be more especially with the work and results.

pros: Wonderful coworkers, excellent teamwork, good benefits
cons:
Favoritism my management, bullied by management. Management does it care about the experienced nurse, has a "you can be replaced" attitude. unit manager seemed to want to replace  more experience nurses (thus cost more to employee) with cheaper fresh out of school nurses..
More money in her pocket to meet budget.

job_title: Patient Accounting Follow Up Representative in Greensboro, NC
pros:
Somewhat flexible 
Company orientation was great made you feel welcome
Coworkers were nice
Food trucks, different vendors, and company discounts
cons: Training was almost non existent, so it’s overwhelming when they say get started. Workload was heavy and it made me second guess asking for help from coworkers because they were busy. Other coworkers said advancement opportunities were limited because they wanted to keep everyone.

pros: flexibility and will work with your schedule, great benefits. and the employees are great to work with at any time.of the day.
cons: Immediately check your department or area for any items (boxes, backpacks, computer cases, etc.) that don’t belong ,Call Security to report anything found that could be related to the threat Obtain the CODE YELLOW Policy for more information and for the “All Clear” report form

review_title: This is an okay place to work

job_title: Weekends Physical Therapist in Burlington, NC
pros: I thought the supervisors were really interested in meeting your needs as an employee.  They were positive, approachable, encouraging, and thoughtful.  Staff worked as a team to get things done.  Communication was good in the inpatient setting.
cons: Their hands were "tied" when trying to make reasonable accommodations when employee needed modifications in order to return to job.  Didn't creatively look outside the box.

cons: It can be so inclusive that it's difficult to move things along.  There are a lot of meetings, partially because it's such an inclusive environment.

review_title: Great company, good middle managers, easy and flexible

I worked PRN, and there was great flexibility in both offering me hours when I had extra time, and cutting back my normal part time schedule when conflicts arose. 
Very good support of continuing education, lots of outreach opportunities. 
Interaction across physicians and allied health specialists was strong and encouraged.
cons: Somewhat small, so opportunities are not expansive.

review_title: Not bad if you don't take 1st offer

pros: Competitive pay for my role and credentials...BUT...
cons: MAKE sure you DONT accept 1st offer. They will offer lowest price possible to see if you'll bite. If you do, you may not know until it's too late. They are a monopoly in Greensboro. They can play some games. Sell yourself and stand up for yourself.

review_title: An organization that really does value their employees.

cons: Pay is fair, but it’s not outstanding. Clinical staff and office staff seem to have different opinions of what it’s like to work here.

review_title: personally rewarding, good job experience, little pay and bad benefits
